summary: Completed frontend testing for SI units (µmol/L) on Acetaminophen nomogram and mmol/L glucose conversions throughout the app. All 9 test cases PASSED.
passed_tests: Acetaminophen nomogram shows SI units (µmol/L) on right Y-axis - Values: 30, 66, 132, 330, 660, 1000, 1320, 2000
Serum level input shows µmol/L conversion below mcg/mL value - '= 993 µmol/L' for 150 mcg/mL
Nomogram result displays both mcg/mL and µmol/L values - 'Treatment threshold: 100 mcg/mL (662 µmol/L)', 'Your level: 150 mcg/mL (993 µmol/L)'
Patient point on nomogram shows both units - '150 (993)' displayed next to red dot
Nomogram has zone labels: 'Probable hepatic toxicity' (red), 'Possible hepatic toxicity' (amber), 'No hepatic toxicity' (green)
DKA approach glucose values show mmol/L - '>200 mg/dL (>11.1 mmol/L)', '<250 mg/dL (<13.9 mmol/L)', '<180 mg/dL (<10 mmol/L)', '>100 mg/dL/hr (>5.6 mmol/L/hr)'
TBI approach glucose target shows mmol/L - '80-180 mg/dL (4.4-10 mmol/L)'
NICU Hypoglycemia approach glucose thresholds show mmol/L - '<25 mg/dL (<1.4 mmol/L)', '<35 mg/dL (<1.9 mmol/L)', '<45 mg/dL (<2.5 mmol/L)', '<60 mg/dL (<3.3 mmol/L)'
Metabolic Emergencies glucose target shows mmol/L - '>180 mg/dL (>10 mmol/L)', 'target 100-120 mg/dL [5.6-6.7 mmol/L]'
critical_code_review_comments: AcetaminophenApproach.jsx: Well-implemented SI unit conversion using mcgToMicromol function (1 mcg/mL = 6.62 µmol/L)
SVG nomogram correctly displays dual Y-axes with mcg/mL on left and µmol/L on right
Zone labels properly positioned and color-coded in the nomogram
All glucose conversions use correct formula: mg/dL ÷ 18 = mmol/L
Consistent formatting across all approaches with mmol/L in brackets/parentheses
context_for_next_testing_agent: SI units and glucose conversions verified across multiple approaches: 1) Acetaminophen nomogram in Children > Approaches - has µmol/L on right Y-axis, conversion display below input, zone labels, and patient point with both units. 2) DKA approach - glucose thresholds with mmol/L. 3) TBI approach - glucose target with mmol/L. 4) Metabolic Emergencies - glucose target with mmol/L. 5) NICU Hypoglycemia - all thresholds with mmol/L. Key conversions verified: 150 mcg/mL = 993 µmol/L (acetaminophen), 200 mg/dL = 11.1 mmol/L (glucose).
